tasks.name: HTML: declaring language for site
tasks.description: allows search engines to properly index your site; allows assistive technologies to pronounce content accurately

tasks.name: HTML: semantic elements: structure
tasks.description: landmark structural elements are semantic: e.g.header, footer, aside, only one 'main' per page

tasks.name: HTML: semantic elements: headings
tasks.description: H1 - H6 headings have semantic meaning, are used only for headings, are used in the right order, only one H1 per page

tasks.name: HTML: <em> and <strong>
tasks.description: used for screen readers to stress emphasis and importance, not used stylistically

tasks.name: HTML: the "alt" attribute
tasks.description: a descriptive text alternative is provided for images, esp. important when image has functional role

tasks.name: HTML: words in/on images
tasks.description: best practice to use real text layered on images, because text within graphics loses readability when zoomed-in

tasks.name: HTML & CSS: background images
tasks.description: background image is decorative and not functional - otherwise use HTML img

tasks.name: HTML: icons
tasks.description: if icons convey meaning (e.g. twitter link), there is text-based context (e.g. visually hidden  + span

tasks.name: CSS  :hover & :focus
tasks.description: all :hover selectors on links are paired with a :focus selector for keyboard users

tasks.name: CSS: text contrast
tasks.description: text-to-background-colour contrast ratio is 4.5:1 for normal text and 3:1 for large text

tasks.name: CSS: font size
tasks.description: avoid small fonts sizes, use relative units (rems) for sizing

tasks.name: CSS: UPPERCASE font choice
tasks.description: limit use of uppercase (screen-readers can misinterpret and readability is limited), apply uppercase using CSS not HTML

tasks.name: CSS fonts & styles
tasks.description: limit the number of fonts for readability (i.e. 2 or 3), avoid blinking, moving or over-animated text

tasks.name: HTML: skip to main
tasks.description: provide a link at page start to bypass top content (e.g. lengthy navs) to skip to main content

tasks.name: HTML: logical forms
tasks.description: all input types in forms are specific to their functionality (e.g.text, submit, email, password)

tasks.name: HTML: labels in forms
tasks.description: all form inputs have a corresponding label to describe function in standard position (or visually hidden)

tasks.name: HTML: buttons vs links
tasks.description: <button> is used functionally; <a> is reserved for links. They respond differently to keyboard events

tasks.name: HTML & CSS: flexbox order
tasks.description: if flexbox order used to change visual order, note it does not change the order in which it is screen-read

tasks.name: multimedia requirements
tasks.description: Video or audio requires transcripts; audio descriptions and captioning if possible
